Description: Two joining fragments of upper wall of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; slipped cream; interior glazed with broad added red band lined in white; below, white dot, part of a rosette; exterior: verticals at rim with band below; in frieze, front part of lion, to right, attacking boar (front part preserved) to left; worn added red.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1188)
